title: Australia is getting a League of Legends Reality Show!

embed.description: Called The Next Gamer, the show will place 10 players in a house in Sydney where they will battle it out for a contract with one of Australia's best League of Legends teams. Applications for the show, which will be broadcast on YouTube, have gone online here.

body:
[EDIT: APPLICATIONS ARE OPEN](https://www.thenextgamer.tv/apply/)


This is kind of a big deal, I think.

replies.body:
Does it come with people getting harassed in chat, reporting, bans and all that stuff? What about promo throwing and inting and the like? Oh oh, what about the players raging at their computer?

I'd watch that.

Actually.... probably not, that hits a bit close to home.

1) that is probably fake, "5 action packed 5 days" yeah there is no way that got through to a press release with any REAL e sports thing.
2) no self respecting gaming team would do this, they would get someone that they know is half decent, not turn it into a shitty TV show.
3)  "Applications for the show, which will be broadcast on YouTube, have gone online here." leads to a random website with no info and just an image.
4) Fact is, if a team needed someone, they would look for someone in the role they need, this sort of thing wouldn't accomplish that, because they'll just get randoms in each role.

You say linking to the same article... which again, doesn't prove it's real.

EDIT: Because i want to be completely clear, there is a few shitty name drops

1) Saying they will Versus Dire Wolves, that's easy to just say, but can't really be proven unless someone from Dire Wolves management says it's the case, and then i would be kinda dissappointed in them
2) A Youtuber called Muselk, who is an overwatch youtuber, who doesn't have anything on his youtube for this (seems like he would)
3) Click Management, who is claimed to be the talent agency, but here is something of Clink Management Inc's Linkedin (because somehow that is the only thing i could find)
"Think of us as your knowledgeable, experienced, trustworthy partner. We specialize in developing custom, web-based solutions focusing on simplicity, security & efficiency."
That is the best result i could find for said "talent agency"

Oops, mb. Screwed my link and I can't find the twitter one I was meant to link. 
I can get someone to verify this for you, to see if its real or fake.

Yeah it's fine, it just looks like a REALLY fake article.

EDIT: Not to mention, umm good luck verifying it? XD

You basically have to contact someone at Dire Wolves, not anyone at Riot.
So I messaged a few of the OPL managers and can confirm that it is indeed real. A more official announcement will be out soon, hopefully within the end of the week :)
I think i'm more disappointed finding out this is real.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=mrJ6hd92,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-31T12:09:06.992+0000)
>
> I think i'm more disappointed finding out this is real.

I'm skeptically hopeful myself.

If it's not very good, I won't be surprised, but if it ends up being good, I'll be pleased.

The issue i keep coming back to is... why would this ever be better than just getting a Whatever role you need in the Challenger/High Diamond scene, and it's never going to be better.

So this will likely just be a publicity stunt for all that ad revenue likely is not.

Not to mention, from the look of it, any role can apply, so they are basically just gonna randomly roll out with a random roled maybe decent player (since it doesn't look like something i can see any ACTUAL diamond+ players going in for, and can see a lot of bronze/silver trash applying.)
I hope falls through, seems like a silly thing to do when there are so many other ways to show player mediocrity that making a show about it.

How do I sign up?
So I can laugh at what happens.
Bahaha you serious? Way to ridiculous to be real, that right there is fake news.
That's all we need, another reality show.....
